gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class Span

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.Span
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Span>

    public class Span
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Span>
    Represents the character offsets of a linguistic object. It is represented with a begin and end character offset. This class also provides methods to compare the positions of two Span objects.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Constructor Detail

      • Span

        public Span(int begin,
            int end)
        Creates a Span object from begin and end character offsets.
        Parameters:
        begin - first character offset of the object
        end - offset of the character following the last character of the object

      • Span

        public Span(java.lang.String charOffset)
        Creates a Span object from a string representation. Assumes hyphen as the delimiter (X-Y).
        Parameters:
        charOffset - a String representation of the Span

      • Span

        public Span(java.lang.String charOffset,
            char separator)
        Creates a Span object from a string representation.
        Parameters:
        charOffset - a String representation of the Span
        separator - the character delimiter between begin and end positions

      • toStandoffAnnotation

        public java.lang.String toStandoffAnnotation()
        Returns a String representation of the Span. Uses space as delimiter.
        Returns:
        the standoff annotation string

      • length

        public int length()

      • overlap

        public static boolean overlap(Span s1,
                              Span s2)
        Determines whether two Span objects overlap.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first Span object
        s2 - the second Span object
        Returns:
        true if the Span objects have overlap

      • subsume

        public static boolean subsume(Span s1,
                              Span s2)
        Determines whether the first Span object subsumes the second completely.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first Span object
        s2 - the second Span object
        Returns:
        true if s1 subsumes s2, or s1 and s2 cover the same span.

      • atLeft

        public static boolean atLeft(Span s1,
                             Span s2)
        Determines whether the first Span object is to the left of the second in its entirety.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first Span object
        s2 - the second Span object
        Returns:
        true if s1 is to the left of s2.

      • union

        public static Span union(Span s1,
                         Span s2)
        Gets the union of two Span objects.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first Span object
        s2 - the second Span object
        Returns:
        the Span object that subsumes both s1 and s2

      • intersection

        public static Span intersection(Span s1,
                                Span s2)
        Returns the intersection of two Span objects.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first Span object
        s2 - the second Span object
        Returns:
        the Span object that is the intersection of s1 and s2

      • invalidSpan

        public static boolean invalidSpan(Span sp)
        Parameters:
        sp - a Span object
        Returns:
        true if the Span object is invalid (begin position is to the right of the end position)
